intro: Elionurus royleanus var. insularis, commonly known as the island elionurus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
